board

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • board.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that holds a 2D array which stores which cells are full.
    Author:
    Sophey

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Constructor, initiates the board

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean checkLine(int lineNum)
      Checks if the line is full to clear
      void checkLines()
      Checks the lines where the piece just landed for completed lines, clears if needed
      void clearBoard()
      Clears the board
      void clearLine(int lineNum)
      Clears the line that is passed through
      void deletePos()
      Deletes the piece from the previous position
      boolean[][] getBoard()
      returns the 2D boolean array
      int[] getCurrentGridPosition()
      returns the current grid position in a 2D array
      Piece getCurrentPiece()
      returns the current piece
      int getNumCols()
      returns the number of columns on the board
      int getNumLines()
      Returns the number of lines cleared
      int getNumRows()
      returns the number of rows on the board
      int getNumTetrises()
      Returns the number of tetrises cleared
      boolean goDown()
      makes the current tetrimino go down, if possible
      boolean goLeft()
      makes the current tetrimino go left, if possible
      boolean goRight()
      makes the current tetrimino go right, if possible
      void initBoard()
      Initiates board
      void newPiece()
      Puts a new random piece onto the board
      boolean rotateCCW()
      rotates the current tetrimino counter-clockwise, if possible
      boolean rotateCW()
      rotates the current tetrimino clockwise, if possible
      void updateBoard()
      Update the board array to reflect the piece's filled squares using the currentGridPosition values and the currentPiece's rotation value.
